013package org.apache.juneau.bean.swagger;
014
015import static org.apache.juneau.common.internal.Utils.*;
016import static org.apache.juneau.internal.ClassUtils.*;
017import static org.apache.juneau.internal.CollectionUtils.*;
018import static org.apache.juneau.internal.ConverterUtils.*;
019
020import java.util.*;
021
022import org.apache.juneau.*;
023import org.apache.juneau.collections.*;
024import org.apache.juneau.common.internal.*;
025import org.apache.juneau.internal.*;
026import org.apache.juneau.json.*;
027import org.apache.juneau.objecttools.*;
028
029/**
030 * This is the root document object for the Swagger 2.0 API specification.
031 *
032 * <p>
033 * The Swagger Object is the root document that describes an entire API. It contains metadata about the API,
034 * available paths and operations, parameters, responses, security definitions, and other information. This is 
035 * the Swagger 2.0 specification (predecessor to OpenAPI 3.0).
036 *
037 * <h5 class='section'>Swagger Specification:</h5>
038 * <p>
039 * The Swagger Object is composed of the following fields:
040 * <ul class='spaced-list'>
041 *    <li><c>swagger</c> (string, REQUIRED) - The Swagger Specification version (must be <js>"2.0"</js>)
042 *    <li><c>info</c> ({@link Info}, REQUIRED) - Provides metadata about the API
043 *    <li><c>host</c> (string) - The host (name or IP) serving the API
044 *    <li><c>basePath</c> (string) - The base path on which the API is served (relative to host)
045 *    <li><c>schemes</c> (array of string) - The transfer protocols of the API (e.g., <js>"http"</js>, <js>"https"</js>)
046 *    <li><c>consumes</c> (array of string) - A list of MIME types the APIs can consume
047 *    <li><c>produces</c> (array of string) - A list of MIME types the APIs can produce
048 *    <li><c>paths</c> (map of {@link OperationMap}, REQUIRED) - The available paths and operations for the API
049 *    <li><c>definitions</c> (map of {@link SchemaInfo}) - Schema definitions that can be referenced
050 *    <li><c>parameters</c> (map of {@link ParameterInfo}) - Parameters definitions that can be referenced
051 *    <li><c>responses</c> (map of {@link ResponseInfo}) - Response definitions that can be referenced
052 *    <li><c>securityDefinitions</c> (map of {@link SecurityScheme}) - Security scheme definitions
053 *    <li><c>security</c> (array of map) - Security requirements applied to all operations
054 *    <li><c>tags</c> (array of {@link Tag}) - A list of tags used by the specification with additional metadata
055 *    <li><c>externalDocs</c> ({@link ExternalDocumentation}) - Additional external documentation
056 * </ul>
057 *
058 * <h5 class='section'>Example:</h5>
059 * <p class='bjava'>
060 *    <jc>// Create a Swagger document</jc>
061 *    Swagger <jv>doc</jv> = <jk>new</jk> Swagger()
062 *       .setSwagger(<js>"2.0"</js>)
063 *       .setInfo(
064 *          <jk>new</jk> Info()
065 *             .setTitle(<js>"Pet Store API"</js>)
066 *             .setVersion(<js>"1.0.0"</js>)
067 *       )
068 *       .setHost(<js>"petstore.swagger.io"</js>)
069 *       .setBasePath(<js>"/v2"</js>)
070 *       .setSchemes(<js>"https"</js>)
071 *       .addPath(<js>"/pets"</js>, <js>"get"</js>, 
072 *          <jk>new</jk> Operation()
073 *             .setSummary(<js>"List all pets"</js>)
074 *             .addResponse(<js>"200"</js>, <jk>new</jk> ResponseInfo(<js>"Success"</js>))
075 *       );
076 * </p>
077 *
078 * <h5 class='section'>See Also:</h5><ul>
079 *    <li class='link'><a class="doclink" href="https://swagger.io/specification/v2/">Swagger 2.0 Specification</a>
080 *    <li class='link'><a class="doclink" href="https://swagger.io/docs/specification/2-0/basic-structure/">Swagger Basic Structure</a>
081 *    <li class='link'><a class="doclink" href="https://juneau.apache.org/docs/topics/JuneauBeanSwagger2">juneau-bean-swagger2</a>
082 * </ul>
083 */
084@FluentSetters
085public class Swagger extends SwaggerElement {
086
087   /** Represents a null swagger */
088   public static final Swagger NULL = new Swagger();
089
090   private static final Comparator<String> PATH_COMPARATOR = (o1, o2) -> o1.replace('{', '@').compareTo(o2.replace('{', '@'));
091
092   private String
093      swagger = "2.0",  // NOSONAR - Intentional naming.
094      host,
095      basePath;
096   private Info info;
097   private ExternalDocumentation externalDocs;
098   private Set<String> schemes;
099   private Set<MediaType>
100      consumes,
101      produces;
102   private Set<Tag> tags;
103   private List<Map<String,List<String>>> security;
104   private Map<String,JsonMap> definitions;
105   private Map<String,ParameterInfo> parameters;
106   private Map<String,ResponseInfo> responses;
107   private Map<String,SecurityScheme> securityDefinitions;
108   private Map<String,OperationMap> paths;
109
110   /**
111    * Default constructor.
112    */
113   public Swagger() {}
114
115   /**
116    * Copy constructor.
117    *
118    * @param copyFrom The object to copy.
119    */
120   public Swagger(Swagger copyFrom) {
121      super(copyFrom);
122
123      this.basePath = copyFrom.basePath;
124      this.consumes = copyOf(copyFrom.consumes);
125      this.externalDocs = copyFrom.externalDocs == null ? null : copyFrom.externalDocs.copy();
126      this.host = copyFrom.host;
127      this.info = copyFrom.info == null ? null : copyFrom.info.copy();
128      this.produces = copyOf(copyFrom.produces);
129      this.schemes = copyOf(copyFrom.schemes);
130      this.swagger = copyFrom.swagger;
131
132      // TODO - Definitions are not deep copied, so they should not contain references.
133      this.definitions = copyOf(copyFrom.definitions, JsonMap::new);
134
135      this.paths = copyOf(copyFrom.paths, v -> {
136         var m = new OperationMap();
137         v.forEach((k2,v2) -> m.put(k2, v2.copy()));
138         return m;
139      });
140
141      this.parameters = copyOf(copyFrom.parameters, ParameterInfo::copy);
142      this.responses = copyOf(copyFrom.responses, ResponseInfo::copy);
143      this.securityDefinitions = copyOf(copyFrom.securityDefinitions, SecurityScheme::copy);
144
145      this.security = copyOf(copyFrom.security, x -> {
146         Map<String,List<String>> m2 = map();
147         x.forEach((k,v) -> m2.put(k, copyOf(v)));
148         return m2;
149      });
150
151      this.tags = copyOf(copyFrom.tags, x -> x.copy());
152   }
153
154   /**
155    * Make a deep copy of this object.
156    *
157    * @return A deep copy of this object.
158    */
159   public Swagger copy() {
160      return new Swagger(this);
161   }
162
163   //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
164   // Properties
165   //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
166
167   /**
168    * Bean property getter:  <property>basePath</property>.
169    *
170    * <p>
171    * The base path on which the API is served, which is relative to the <c>host</c>.
172    *
173    * @return The property value, or <jk>null</jk> if it is not set.
174    */
175   public String getBasePath() {
176      return basePath;
177   }
178
179   /**
180    * Bean property setter:  <property>basePath</property>.
181    *
182    * <p>
183    * The base path on which the API is served, which is relative to the <c>host</c>.
184    *
185    * @param value
186    *    The new value for this property.
187    *    <br>If it is not included, the API is served directly under the <c>host</c>.
188    *    <br>The value MUST start with a leading slash (/).
189    *    <br>The <c>basePath</c> does not support <a class="doclink" href="https://swagger.io/specification/v2#pathTemplating">path templating</a>.
190    *    <br>Can be <jk>null</jk> to unset the property.
191    * @return This object.
192    */
193   public Swagger setBasePath(String value) {
194      basePath = value;
195      return this;
196   }
197
198   /**
199    * Bean property getter:  <property>consumes</property>.
200    *
201    * <p>
202    * A list of MIME types the APIs can consume.
203    *
204    * @return The property value, or <jk>null</jk> if it is not set.
205    */
206   public Set<MediaType> getConsumes() {
207      return consumes;
208   }
209
210   /**
211    * Bean property setter:  <property>consumes</property>.
212    *
213    * <p>
214    * A list of MIME types the APIs can consume.
215    *
216    * @param value
217    *    The new value for this property.
218    *    <br>Value MUST be as described under <a class="doclink" href="https://swagger.io/specification#mimeTypes">Swagger Mime Types</a>.
219    *    <br>Can be <jk>null</jk> to unset the property.
220    * @return This object.
221    */
222   public Swagger setConsumes(Collection<MediaType> value) {
223      consumes = setFrom(value);
224      return this;
225   }
226
227   /**
228    * Bean property appender:  <property>consumes</property>.
229    *
230    * <p>
231    * A list of MIME types the APIs can consume.
232    *
233    * @param values
234    *    The values to add to this property.
235    *    <br>Values MUST be as described under <a class="doclink" href="https://swagger.io/specification#mimeTypes">Swagger Mime Types</a>.
236    *    <br>Ignored if <jk>null</jk>.
237    * @return This object.
238    */
239   public Swagger addConsumes(MediaType...values) {
240      consumes = setBuilder(consumes).sparse().add(values).build();
241      return this;
242   }
243
244   /**
245    * Bean property fluent setter:  <property>consumes</property>.
246    *
247    * <p>
248    * A list of MIME types the APIs can consume.
249    *
250    * @param value
251    *    The values to set on this property.
252    * @return This object.
253    */
254   public Swagger setConsumes(MediaType...value) {
255      setConsumes(setBuilder(MediaType.class).sparse().add(value).build());
256      return this;
257   }
258
259   /**
260    * Bean property getter:  <property>definitions</property>.
261    *
262    * <p>
263    * An object to hold data types produced and consumed by operations.
264    *
265    * @return The property value, or <jk>null</jk> if it is not set.
266    */
267   public Map<String,JsonMap> getDefinitions() {
268      return definitions;
269   }
270
271   /**
272    * Bean property setter:  <property>definitions</property>.
273    *
274    * <p>
275    * An object to hold data types produced and consumed by operations.
276    *
277    * @param value
278    *    The new value for this property.
279    *    <br>Can be <jk>null</jk> to unset the property.
280    * @return This object.
281    */
282   public Swagger setDefinitions(Map<String,JsonMap> value) {
283      definitions = copyOf(value);
284      return this;
285   }
286
287   /**
288    * Bean property appender:  <property>definitions</property>.
289    *
290    * <p>
291    * Adds a single value to the <property>definitions</property> property.
292    *
293    * @param name A definition name.  Must not be <jk>null</jk>.
294    * @param schema The schema that the name defines.  Must not be <jk>null</jk>.
295    * @return This object.
296    */
297   public Swagger addDefinition(String name, JsonMap schema) {
298      assertArgNotNull("name", name);
299      assertArgNotNull("schema", schema);
300      definitions = mapBuilder(definitions).sparse().add(name, schema).build();
301      return this;
302   }
303
304   /**
305    * Bean property getter:  <property>externalDocs</property>.
306    *
307    * <p>
308    * Additional external documentation.
309    *
310    * @return The property value, or <jk>null</jk> if it is not set.
311    */
312   public ExternalDocumentation getExternalDocs() {
313      return externalDocs;
314   }
315
316   /**
317    * Bean property setter:  <property>externalDocs</property>.
318    *
319    * <p>
320    * Additional external documentation.
321    *
322    * @param value
323    *    The new value for this property.
324    *    <br>Can be <jk>null</jk> to unset the property.
325    * @return This object.
326    */
327   public Swagger setExternalDocs(ExternalDocumentation value) {
328      externalDocs = value;
329      return this;
330   }
331
332   /**
333    * Bean property getter:  <property>host</property>.
334    *
335    * <p>
336    * The host (name or IP) serving the API.
337    *
338    * @return The property value, or <jk>null</jk> if it is not set.
339    */
340   public String getHost() {
341      return host;
342   }
343
344   /**
345    * Bean property setter:  <property>host</property>.
346    *
347    * <p>
348    * The host (name or IP) serving the API.
349    *
350    * @param value
351    *    The new value for this property.
352    *    <br>This MUST be the host only and does not include the scheme nor sub-paths.
353    *    <br>It MAY include a port.
354    *    <br>If the host is not included, the host serving the documentation is to be used (including the port).
355    *    <br>The host does not support <a class="doclink" href="https://swagger.io/specification/v2#pathTemplating">path templating</a>
356    *    <br>Can be <jk>null</jk> to unset the property.
357    * @return This object.
358    */
359   public Swagger setHost(String value) {
360      host = value;
361      return this;
362   }
363
364   /**
365    * Bean property getter:  <property>info</property>.
366    *
367    * <p>
368    * Provides metadata about the API.
369    *
370    * @return The property value, or <jk>null</jk> if it is not set.
371    */
372   public Info getInfo() {
373      return info;
374   }
375
376   /**
377    * Bean property setter:  <property>info</property>.
378    *
379    * <p>
380    * Provides metadata about the API.
381    *
382    * @param value
383    *    The new value for this property.
384    *    <br>Property value is required.
385    *    <br>Can be <jk>null</jk> to unset the property.
386    * @return This object.
387    */
388   public Swagger setInfo(Info value) {
389      info = value;
390      return this;
391   }
392
393   /**
394    * Bean property getter:  <property>parameters</property>.
395    *
396    * <p>
397    * An object to hold parameters that can be used across operations.
398    *
399    * @return The property value, or <jk>null</jk> if it is not set.
400    */
401   public Map<String,ParameterInfo> getParameters() {
402      return parameters;
403   }
404
405   /**
406    * Bean property setter:  <property>parameters</property>.
407    *
408    * <p>
409    * An object to hold parameters that can be used across operations.
410    *
411    * @param value
412    *    The new value for this property.
413    *    <br>Can be <jk>null</jk> to unset the property.
414    * @return This object.
415    */
416   public Swagger setParameters(Map<String,ParameterInfo> value) {
417      parameters = copyOf(value);
418      return this;
419   }
420
421   /**
422    * Bean property appender:  <property>parameters</property>.
423    *
424    * <p>
425    * Adds a single value to the <property>parameter</property> property.
426    *
427    * @param name The parameter name.  Must not be <jk>null</jk>.
428    * @param parameter The parameter definition.  Must not be <jk>null</jk>.
429    * @return This object.
430    */
431   public Swagger addParameter(String name, ParameterInfo parameter) {
432      assertArgNotNull("name", name);
433      assertArgNotNull("parameter", parameter);
434      parameters = mapBuilder(parameters).sparse().add(name, parameter).build();
435      return this;
436   }
437
438   /**
439    * Bean property getter:  <property>paths</property>.
440    *
441    * <p>
442    * The available paths and operations for the API.
443    *
444    * @return The property value, or <jk>null</jk> if it is not set.
445    */
446   public Map<String,OperationMap> getPaths() {
447      return paths;
448   }
449
450   /**
451    * Bean property setter:  <property>paths</property>.
452    *
453    * <p>
454    * The available paths and operations for the API.
455    *
456    * @param value
457    *    The new value for this property.
458    *    <br>Property value is required.
459    *    <br>Can be <jk>null</jk> to unset the property.
460    * @return This object.
461    */
462   public Swagger setPaths(Map<String,OperationMap> value) {
463      paths = mapBuilder(String.class,OperationMap.class).sparse().sorted(PATH_COMPARATOR).addAll(value).build();
464      return this;
465   }
466
467   /**
468    * Bean property appender:  <property>paths</property>.
469    *
470    * <p>
471    * Adds a single value to the <property>paths</property> property.
472    *
473    * @param path The path template.  Must not be <jk>null</jk>.
474    * @param methodName The HTTP method name.  Must not be <jk>null</jk>.
475    * @param operation The operation that describes the path.  Must not be <jk>null</jk>.
476    * @return This object.
477    */
478   public Swagger addPath(String path, String methodName, Operation operation) {
479      assertArgNotNull("path", path);
480      assertArgNotNull("methodName", methodName);
481      assertArgNotNull("operation", operation);
482      if (paths == null)
483         paths = new TreeMap<>(PATH_COMPARATOR);
484      getPaths().computeIfAbsent(path, k -> new OperationMap()).put(methodName, operation);
485      return this;
486   }
487
488   /**
489    * Bean property getter:  <property>produces</property>.
490    *
491    * <p>
492    * A list of MIME types the APIs can produce.
493    *
494    * @return The property value, or <jk>null</jk> if it is not set.
495    */
496   public Set<MediaType> getProduces() {
497      return produces;
498   }
499
500   /**
501    * Bean property setter:  <property>produces</property>.
502    *
503    * <p>
504    * A list of MIME types the APIs can produce.
505    *
506    * @param value
507    *    The new value for this property.
508    *    <br>Value MUST be as described under <a class="doclink" href="https://swagger.io/specification#mimeTypes">Swagger Mime Types</a>.
509    *    <br>Can be <jk>null</jk> to unset the property.
510    * @return This object.
511    */
512   public Swagger setProduces(Collection<MediaType> value) {
513      produces = setFrom(value);
514      return this;
515   }
516
517   /**
518    * Adds one or more values to the <property>produces</property> property.
519    *
520    * <p>
521    * A list of MIME types the APIs can produce.
522    *
523    * @param values
524    *    The values to add to this property.
525    *    <br>Value MUST be as described under <a class="doclink" href="https://swagger.io/specification#mimeTypes">Swagger Mime Types</a>.
526    *    <br>Can be <jk>null</jk> to unset the property.
527    * @return This object.
528    */
529   public Swagger addProduces(MediaType...values) {
530      produces = setBuilder(produces).sparse().add(values).build();
531      return this;
532   }
533
534   /**
535    * Bean property fluent setter:  <property>produces</property>.

537    * <p>

540    * @param value
541    *    The new value for this property.
542    * @return This object.
543    */
544   public Swagger setProduces(MediaType...value) {
545      setProduces(setBuilder(MediaType.class).sparse().add(value).build());
546      return this;
547   }

556    */
557   public Map<String,ResponseInfo> getResponses() {
558      return responses;
559   }
560
561   /**
562    * Bean property setter:  <property>responses</property>.
563    *
564    * <p>
565    * An object to hold responses that can be used across operations.
566    *

568    *    The new value for this property.
569    *    <br>Can be <jk>null</jk> to unset the property.
570    * @return This object.
571    */
572   public Swagger setResponses(Map<String,ResponseInfo> value) {
573      responses = copyOf(value);
574      return this;
575   }
576
577   /**
578    * Bean property appender:  <property>responses</property>.
579    *
580    * <p>
581    * Adds a single value to the <property>responses</property> property.
582    *
583    * @param name The response name.  Must not be <jk>null</jk>.
584    * @param response The response definition.  Must not be <jk>null</jk>.
585    * @return This object.
586    */
587   public Swagger addResponse(String name, ResponseInfo response) {
588      assertArgNotNull("name", name);
589      assertArgNotNull("response", response);
590      responses = mapBuilder(responses).sparse().add(name, response).build();
591      return this;
592   }
593
594   /**
595    * Bean property getter:  <property>schemes</property>.
596    *
597    * <p>
598    * The transfer protocol of the API.
599    *
600    * @return The property value, or <jk>null</jk> if it is not set.
601    */
602   public Set<String> getSchemes() {
603      return schemes;
604   }
605
606   /**
607    * Bean property setter:  <property>schemes</property>.
608    *
609    * <p>
610    * The transfer protocol of the API.
611    *
612    * @param value
613    *    The new value for this property.
614    *    <br>Valid values:
615    *    <ul>
616    *       <li><js>"http"</js>
617    *       <li><js>"https"</js>
618    *       <li><js>"ws"</js>
619    *       <li><js>"wss"</js>
620    *    </ul>
621    *    <br>Can be <jk>null</jk> to unset the property.
622    * @return This object.
623    */
624   public Swagger setSchemes(Collection<String> value) {
625      schemes = setFrom(value);
626      return this;
627   }
628
629   /**
630    * Bean property appender:  <property>schemes</property>.
631    *
632    * <p>
633    * The transfer protocol of the API.
634    *
635    * @param values
636    *    The values to add to this property.
637    *    <br>Valid values:
638    *    <ul>
639    *       <li><js>"http"</js>
640    *       <li><js>"https"</js>
641    *       <li><js>"ws"</js>
642    *       <li><js>"wss"</js>
643    *    </ul>
644    *    <br>Ignored if <jk>null</jk>.
645    * @return This object.
646    */
647   public Swagger addSchemes(String...values) {
648      schemes = setBuilder(schemes).sparse().add(values).build();
649      return this;
650   }
651
652   /**
653    * Bean property fluent setter:  <property>schemes</property>.
654    *
655    * <p>
656    * The transfer protocol of the API.
657    *
658    * @param value
659    *    The new value for this property.
660    *    <br>Strings can be JSON arrays.
661    * @return This object.
662    */
663   public Swagger setSchemes(String...value) {
664      setSchemes(setBuilder(String.class).sparse().addJson(value).build());
665      return this;
666   }
667
668   /**
669    * Bean property getter:  <property>security</property>.
670    *
671    * <p>
672    * A declaration of which security schemes are applied for the API as a whole.
673    *
674    * @return The property value, or <jk>null</jk> if it is not set.
675    */
676   public List<Map<String,List<String>>> getSecurity() {
677      return security;
678   }
679
680   /**
681    * Bean property setter:  <property>security</property>.
682    *
683    * <p>
684    * A declaration of which security schemes are applied for the API as a whole.
685    *
686    * @param value
687    *    The new value for this property.
688    *    <br>Can be <jk>null</jk> to unset the property.
689    * @return This object.
690    */
691   public Swagger setSecurity(Collection<Map<String,List<String>>> value) {
692      security = listFrom(value);
693      return this;
694   }
695
696   /**
697    * Bean property appender:  <property>security</property>.
698    *
699    * <p>
700    * Adds a single value to the <property>securityDefinitions</property> property.
701    *
702    * @param scheme The security scheme that applies to this operation  Must not be <jk>null</jk>.
703    * @param alternatives
704    *    The list of values describes alternative security schemes that can be used (that is, there is a logical OR between the security requirements).
705    * @return This object.
706    */
707   public Swagger addSecurity(String scheme, String...alternatives) {
708      assertArgNotNull("scheme", scheme);
709      Map<String,List<String>> m = map();
710      m.put(scheme, alist(alternatives));
711      security = listBuilder(security).sparse().addAll(Collections.singleton(m)).build();
712      return this;
713   }
714
715   /**
716    * Bean property getter:  <property>securityDefinitions</property>.
717    *
718    * <p>
719    * Security scheme definitions that can be used across the specification.
720    *
721    * @return The property value, or <jk>null</jk> if it is not set.
722    */
723   public Map<String,SecurityScheme> getSecurityDefinitions() {
724      return securityDefinitions;
725   }

727   /**
728    * Bean property setter:  <property>securityDefinitions</property>.
729    *
730    * <p>
731    * Security scheme definitions that can be used across the specification.
732    *
733    * @param value
734    *    The new value for this property.
735    *    <br>Can be <jk>null</jk> to unset the property.
736    * @return This object.
737    */
738   public Swagger setSecurityDefinitions(Map<String,SecurityScheme> value) {
739      securityDefinitions = copyOf(value);
740      return this;
741   }
742
743   /**
744    * Bean property appender:  <property>securityDefinitions</property>.
745    *
746    * <p>
747    * Adds a single value to the <property>securityDefinitions</property> property.
748    *
749    * @param name A security name.  Must not be <jk>null</jk>.
750    * @param securityScheme A security schema.  Must not be <jk>null</jk>.
751    * @return This object.
752    */
753   public Swagger addSecurityDefinition(String name, SecurityScheme securityScheme) {
754      assertArgNotNull("name", name);
755      assertArgNotNull("securityScheme", securityScheme);
756      securityDefinitions = mapBuilder(securityDefinitions).sparse().add(name, securityScheme).build();
757      return this;
758   }

789   /**
790    * Bean property getter:  <property>tags</property>.
791    *
792    * <p>
793    * A list of tags used by the specification with additional metadata.
794    *
795    * @return The property value, or <jk>null</jk> if it is not set.
796    */
797   public Set<Tag> getTags() {
798      return tags;
799   }
800
801   /**
802    * Bean property setter:  <property>tags</property>.
803    *
804    * <p>
805    * A list of tags used by the specification with additional metadata.
806    *
807    * @param value
808    *    The new value for this property.
809    *    <br>The order of the tags can be used to reflect on their order by the parsing tools.
810    *    <br>Not all tags that are used by the <a class="doclink" href="https://swagger.io/specification/v2#operationObject">Operation Object</a> must be declared.
811    *    <br>The tags that are not declared may be organized randomly or based on the tools' logic.
812    *    <br>Each tag name in the list MUST be unique.
813    *    <br>Can be <jk>null</jk> to unset the property.
814    * @return This object.
815    */
816   public Swagger setTags(Collection<Tag> value) {
817      tags = setFrom(value);
818      return this;
819   }
820
821   /**
822    * Bean property appender:  <property>tags</property>.
823    *
824    * <p>
825    * A list of tags used by the specification with additional metadata.
826    *
827    * @param values
828    *    The values to add to this property.
829    *    <br>The order of the tags can be used to reflect on their order by the parsing tools.
830    *    <br>Not all tags that are used by the <a class="doclink" href="https://swagger.io/specification/v2#operationObject">Operation Object</a> must be declared.
831    *    <br>The tags that are not declared may be organized randomly or based on the tools' logic.
832    *    <br>Each tag name in the list MUST be unique.
833    *    <br>Ignored if <jk>null</jk>.
834    * @return This object.
835    */
836   public Swagger addTags(Tag...values) {
837      tags = setBuilder(tags).sparse().add(values).build();
838      return this;
839   }
840
841   //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
842   // Convenience methods
843   //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
844
845   /**
846    * Shortcut for calling <c>getPaths().get(path);</c>
847    *
848    * @param path The path (e.g. <js>"/foo"</js>).  Must not be <jk>null</jk>.
849    * @return The operation map for the specified path, or <jk>null</jk> if it doesn't exist.
850    */
851   public OperationMap getPath(String path) {
852      assertArgNotNull("path", path);
853      return getPaths().get(path);
854   }
855
856   /**
857    * Shortcut for calling <c>getPaths().get(path).get(operation);</c>
858    *
859    * @param path The path (e.g. <js>"/foo"</js>).  Must not be <jk>null</jk>.
860    * @param operation The HTTP operation (e.g. <js>"get"</js>).  Must not be <jk>null</jk>.
861    * @return The operation for the specified path and operation id, or <jk>null</jk> if it doesn't exist.
862    */
863   public Operation getOperation(String path, String operation) {
864      assertArgNotNull("path", path);
865      assertArgNotNull("operation", operation);
866      var om = getPath(path);
867      if (om == null)
868         return null;
869      return om.get(operation);
870   }
871
872   /**
873    * Shortcut for calling <c>getPaths().get(path).get(operation).getResponse(status);</c>
874    *
875    * @param path The path (e.g. <js>"/foo"</js>).  Must not be <jk>null</jk>.
876    * @param operation The HTTP operation (e.g. <js>"get"</js>).  Must not be <jk>null</jk>.
877    * @param status The HTTP response status (e.g. <js>"200"</js>).  Must not be <jk>null</jk>.
878    * @return The operation for the specified path and operation id, or <jk>null</jk> if it doesn't exist.
879    */
880   public ResponseInfo getResponseInfo(String path, String operation, String status) {
881      assertArgNotNull("path", path);
882      assertArgNotNull("operation", operation);
883      assertArgNotNull("status", status);
884      var om = getPath(path);
885      if (om == null)
886         return null;
887      var op = om.get(operation);
888      if (op == null)
889         return null;
890      return op.getResponse(status);
891   }
892
893   /**
894    * Shortcut for calling <c>getPaths().get(path).get(operation).getResponse(status);</c>
895    *
896    * @param path The path (e.g. <js>"/foo"</js>).
897    * @param operation The HTTP operation (e.g. <js>"get"</js>).
898    * @param status The HTTP response status (e.g. <js>"200"</js>).
899    * @return The operation for the specified path and operation id, or <jk>null</jk> if it doesn't exist.
900    */
901   public ResponseInfo getResponseInfo(String path, String operation, int status) {
902      return getResponseInfo(path, operation, String.valueOf(status));
903   }
904
905   /**
906    * Convenience method for calling <c>getPath(path).get(method).getParameter(in,name);</c>
907    *
908    * @param path The HTTP path.  Must not be <jk>null</jk>.
909    * @param method The HTTP method.  Must not be <jk>null</jk>.
910    * @param in The parameter type.  Must not be <jk>null</jk>.
911    * @param name The parameter name.  Can be <jk>null</jk> for parameter type <c>body</c>.
912    * @return The parameter information or <jk>null</jk> if not found.
913    */
914   public ParameterInfo getParameterInfo(String path, String method, String in, String name) {
915      assertArgNotNull("path", path);
916      assertArgNotNull("method", method);
917      assertArgNotNull("in", in);
918      var om = getPath(path);
919      if (om != null) {
920         var o = om.get(method);
921         if (o != null) {
922            return o.getParameter(in, name);
923         }
924      }
925      return null;
926   }
927
928   // <FluentSetters>
929
930   // </FluentSetters>
931
932   @Override /* SwaggerElement */
933   public <T> T get(String property, Class<T> type) {
934      assertArgNotNull("property", property);
935      return switch (property) {
936         case "basePath" -> toType(getBasePath(), type);
937         case "consumes" -> toType(getConsumes(), type);
938         case "definitions" -> toType(getDefinitions(), type);
939         case "externalDocs" -> toType(getExternalDocs(), type);
940         case "host" -> toType(getHost(), type);
941         case "info" -> toType(getInfo(), type);
942         case "parameters" -> toType(getParameters(), type);
943         case "paths" -> toType(getPaths(), type);
944         case "produces" -> toType(getProduces(), type);
945         case "responses" -> toType(getResponses(), type);
946         case "schemes" -> toType(getSchemes(), type);
947         case "security" -> toType(getSecurity(), type);
948         case "securityDefinitions" -> toType(getSecurityDefinitions(), type);
949         case "swagger" -> toType(getSwagger(), type);
950         case "tags" -> toType(getTags(), type);
951         default -> super.get(property, type);
952      };
953   }
954
955   @SuppressWarnings("rawtypes")
956   @Override /* SwaggerElement */
957   public Swagger set(String property, Object value) {
958      assertArgNotNull("property", property);
959      return switch (property) {
960         case "basePath" -> setBasePath(Utils.s(value));
961         case "consumes" -> setConsumes(listBuilder(MediaType.class).sparse().addAny(value).build());
962         case "definitions" -> setDefinitions(mapBuilder(String.class,JsonMap.class).sparse().addAny(value).build());
963         case "externalDocs" -> setExternalDocs(toType(value, ExternalDocumentation.class));
964         case "host" -> setHost(Utils.s(value));
965         case "info" -> setInfo(toType(value, Info.class));
966         case "parameters" -> setParameters(mapBuilder(String.class,ParameterInfo.class).sparse().addAny(value).build());
967         case "paths" -> setPaths(mapBuilder(String.class,OperationMap.class).sparse().addAny(value).build());
968         case "produces" -> setProduces(listBuilder(MediaType.class).sparse().addAny(value).build());
969         case "responses" -> setResponses(mapBuilder(String.class,ResponseInfo.class).sparse().addAny(value).build());
970         case "schemes" -> setSchemes(listBuilder(String.class).sparse().addAny(value).build());
971         case "security" -> setSecurity((List)listBuilder(Map.class,String.class,List.class,String.class).sparse().addAny(value).build());
972         case "securityDefinitions" -> setSecurityDefinitions(mapBuilder(String.class,SecurityScheme.class).sparse().addAny(value).build());
973         case "swagger" -> setSwagger(Utils.s(value));
974         case "tags" -> setTags(listBuilder(Tag.class).sparse().addAny(value).build());
975         default -> {
976            super.set(property, value);
977            yield this;
978         }
979      };
980   }
981
982   @Override /* SwaggerElement */
983   public Set<String> keySet() {
984      var s = setBuilder(String.class)
985         .addIf(basePath != null, "basePath")
986         .addIf(consumes != null, "consumes")
987         .addIf(definitions != null, "definitions")
988         .addIf(externalDocs != null, "externalDocs")
989         .addIf(host != null, "host")
990         .addIf(info != null, "info")
991         .addIf(parameters != null, "parameters")
992         .addIf(paths != null, "paths")
993         .addIf(produces != null, "produces")
994         .addIf(responses != null, "responses")
995         .addIf(schemes != null, "schemes")
996         .addIf(security != null, "security")
997         .addIf(securityDefinitions != null, "securityDefinitions")
998         .addIf(swagger != null, "swagger")
999         .addIf(tags != null, "tags")
1000         .build();
1001      return new MultiSet<>(s, super.keySet());
1002   }

1004   /**
1005    * A synonym of {@link #toString()}.
1006    * @return This object serialized as JSON.
1007    */
1008   public String asJson() {
1009      return toString();
1010   }
1011
1012   @Override /* Object */
1013   public String toString() {
1014      return JsonSerializer.DEFAULT.toString(this);
1015   }
1016
1017   /**
1018    * Resolves a <js>"$ref"</js> tags to nodes in this swagger document.
1019    *
1020    * @param <T> The class to convert the reference to.
1021    * @param ref The ref tag value.  Must not be <jk>null</jk> or blank.
1022    * @param c The class to convert the reference to.  Must not be <jk>null</jk>.
1023    * @return The referenced node, or <jk>null</jk> if not found.
1024    */
1025   public <T> T findRef(String ref, Class<T> c) {
1026      assertArgNotNullOrBlank("ref", ref);
1027      assertArgNotNull("c", c);
1028      if (! ref.startsWith("#/"))
1029         throw new BasicRuntimeException("Unsupported reference:  ''{0}''", ref);
1030      try {
1031         return new ObjectRest(this).get(ref.substring(1), c);
1032      } catch (Exception e) {
1033         throw new BeanRuntimeException(e, c, "Reference ''{0}'' could not be converted to type ''{1}''.", ref, className(c));
1034      }
1035   }
1036

1038    * Sets strict mode on this bean.
1039    *
1040    * @return This object.
1041    */
1042   @Override
1043   public Swagger strict() {
1044      super.strict();
1045      return this;
1046   }
1047
1048   /**
1049    * Sets strict mode on this bean.
1050    *
1051    * @param value
1052    *    The new value for this property.
1053    *    <br>Non-boolean values will be converted to boolean using <code>Boolean.<jsm>valueOf</jsm>(value.toString())</code>.
1054    *    <br>Can be <jk>null</jk> (interpreted as <jk>false</jk>).
1055    * @return This object.
1056    */
1057   @Override
1058   public Swagger strict(Object value) {
1059      super.strict(value);
1060      return this;
1061   }
